content: angel hat this hat was designed during a very tough we can never fully express how much you time for me and my family and it was knit all have helped us but i hope this little with you all in my mind pattern goes some way to showing you during this time we have had such a huge i named this the angel hat because you are amount of support and love from all of you i all angels to us and also because its a nick really wanted to do something to give a little name i use for dan yes i might be a buffy back and show you all just how much it has fan… meant to us thank you so much everyone i hope you enjoy it we all live within this wonderful community sharing our love of this fabulous craft and being part of that means so much to us both hugs kay x © 2017 kay jones angel hat for personal use only - do not reproduce bakerybears@btinternet com page 1 notions 4mm us size 6 and 4 5mm us size 7 16- inch circular needle 4 5mm set of double pointed needles yarn tapestry needle and a stitch marker approx 180 yards 166 metres of worsted or aran weight yarn pattern sample is knit with the following - 1 skein of bakery bears cottage castleton base 100% super wash merino aran weight 166m in empower mint abbreviations k - knit p - purl k2tog - knit 2 stitches together decreasing by one stitch p2tog - purl 2 stitches together decreasing by one stitch gauge 24 stitches and 27 row = 4 inches 10cm washed and blocked measurement in the texture stitch using 4 5mm needles finished dimensions the pattern is one size that will fit an average adult head 21 to 23 inches in diameter © 2017 kay jones angel hat for personal use only - do not reproduce bakerybears@btinternet com page 2 cast on and hat brim using the long tail cast-on method and 4mm round 6 - purl all stitches needles cast on 100 stitches place a stitch marker and then join for knitting in the round round 7 - k1 p1 twice k1 k2tog repeat to end of round 60 stitches round 1 - k1 p1 to the end of the round round 8 - k1 p1 repeat to end of round repeat this round until the hat measures 3 inches from the cast-on edge round 9 - p4 p2tog repeat to end of round 50 stitches hat body round 10 - k1 p1 twice p1 repeat to end of change to 4 5mm needles round round 1 - k1 p1 to the end of the round round 11 - k1 p1 k1 k2tog repeat to end of round 40 stitches round 2 - as round 1 round 12 - p2 p2tog repeat to end of round 30 round 3 - purl all stitches stitches repeat these 3 rounds
